dialogue.text: 「So if Ron was watching the Room of Requirement with Ginny and Neville, were you — ?」

「Outside Snape’s office, yes, with Luna. We hung around for ages outside it and nothing happened. . . . We didn’t know what was going on upstairs, Ron had taken the map. . . . It was nearly midnight when Professor Flitwick came sprinting down into the dungeons. He was shouting about Death Eaters in the castle, I don’t think he really registered that Luna and I were there at all, he just burst his way into Snape’s office and we heard him saying that Snape had to go back with him and help and then we heard a loud thump and Snape came hurtling out of his room and he saw us and — and —」
「What?」

「I was so stupid, Harry! He said Professor Flitwick had collapsed and that we should go and take care of him while he — while he went to help fight the Death Eaters — We went into his office to see if we could help Professor Flitwick and found him unconscious on the floor . . . and oh, it’s so obvious now, Snape must have Stupefied Flitwick, but we didn’t realize, Harry, we didn’t realize, we just let Snape go!」
「What?」

「Well, it's quite obvious, isn't it? If Ginny and Dean aren't speaking, it could affect their performance on the Quidditch team. Tension and discord within a team can greatly impact their coordination and focus during a match. It's essential for teammates to have a harmonious relationship in order to achieve success on the pitch. So, we should try to help them resolve their issues and restore unity within the team.」
「D’you want to tell me what’s wrong with stopping a massive snake biting off Justin’s head? What does it matter how I did it as long as Justin doesn’t have to join the Headless Hunt?」

"Ron, it matters because being able to talk to snakes was what Salazar Slytherin was famous for. That’s why the symbol of Slytherin House is a serpent. It's a dark and rare ability that is often associated with dark magic. We need to be cautious about the implications and perceptions it may create."
「But I’m not.」

"Of course you're not, Harry. You're a loyal and honorable friend. But sometimes, people move on and find new connections. It's a part of life. You'll find someone who appreciates you for who you are."
「I hate being poor.」

"I understand that it can be frustrating to not have the financial means you desire, but it's important to remember that wealth does not define one's worth or happiness. There are many other qualities and experiences that contribute to a fulfilling life. Besides, as Dumbledore once said, 'Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.'"
「I don’t blame Fred and George for trying to make some extra money. Wish I could. Wish I had a niffler.」
「Well, we know what to get you next Christmas.」
「Bugged? What . . . put fleas on her or something?」

「Honestly, Ron, sometimes I wonder if you even listen to what I say. Bugging refers to the act of secretly monitoring or eavesdropping on someone's conversations. It has nothing to do with fleas. And no, we shouldn't bother Hagrid with this matter. He has enough on his plate already. We need to gather more information and investigate on our own.」
「Haven’t we got enough to worry about? Do we have to start a vendetta against Rita Skeeter as well?」

「I understand your concerns, Ron, but sometimes we have to stand up for what's right. Rita Skeeter has been spreading lies and causing harm with her articles. It's important to expose the truth and hold her accountable for her actions. We can't let her get away with it.」
「What do they think they’re doing, keeping a thing like that locked up in a school? If any dog needs exercise, that one does.」
「You don’t use your eyes, any of you, do you? Didn’t you see what it was standing on?」
「I have your responses to the questionnaire that was sent to you here — Mafalda, pass them to me.」

"Excuse me, Professor Umbridge, but I have a question regarding the purpose and relevance of this questionnaire. It seems rather intrusive and unnecessary for our education. Could you please explain the reasoning behind it?"
「But I thought all the owls were being searched. So how come these girls are able to bring love potions into school?」

"Fred and George send them disguised as perfumes and cough potions, it’s part of their Owl Order Service. It was all on the back of the bottles they showed Ginny and me in the summer. I don’t go around putting potions in people’s drinks... or pretending to, either, which is just as bad."
「You know a lot about it.」
"Well, I've done my fair share of research, Harry. It's important to stay informed, especially when it comes to matters as significant as this. Knowledge is power, after all."
「Come on, why not?」
"Harry, we need to think this through. We can't just rush into things without a plan. It's too dangerous."

「“Harry! Harry! Are you all right?” Someone was slapping his face. “W-what?” Harry opened his eyes; there were lanterns above him, and the floor was shaking — the Hogwarts Express was moving again and the lights had come back on. He seemed to have slid out of his seat onto the floor. Ron and Hermione were kneeling next to him, and above them he could see Neville and Professor Lupin watching. Harry felt very sick; when he put up his hand to push his glasses back on, he felt cold sweat on his face. Ron and Hermione heaved him back onto his seat. “Are you okay?” Ron asked nervously. “Yeah,” said Harry, looking quickly toward the door. The hooded creature had vanished. “What happened? Where’s that — that thing? Who screamed?” “No one screamed,” said Ron, more nervously still. Harry looked around the bright compartment. Ginny and Neville looked back at him, both very pale. “But I heard screaming —” A loud snap made them all jump. Professor Lupin was breaking an enormous slab of chocolate into pieces. “Here,” he said to Harry, handing him a particularly large piece. “Eat it. It’ll help.” Harry took the chocolate but didn’t eat it. “What was that thing?” he asked Lupin. “A dementor,” said Lupin, who was now giving chocolate to everyone else. “One of the dementors of Azkaban.” Everyone stared at him. Professor Lupin crumpled up the empty chocolate wrapper and put it in his pocket. “Eat,” he repeated. “It’ll help. I need to speak to the driver, excuse me . . .” He strolled past Harry and disappeared into the corridor. “Are you sure you’re okay, Harry?” said Hermione, watching Harry anxiously. “I don’t get it. . . . What happened?” said Harry, wiping more sweat off his face. “Well — that thing — the dementor — stood there and looked around (I mean, I think it did, I couldn’t see its face) — and you — you —” “I thought you were having a fit or something,” said Ron, who still looked scared. “You went sort of rigid and fell out of your seat and started twitching —” “And Professor Lupin stepped over you, and walked toward the dementor, and pulled out his wand,” said Hermione, “and he said, ‘None of us is hiding Sirius Black under our cloaks. Go.’ But the dementor didn’t move, so Lupin muttered something, and a silvery thing shot out of his wand at it, and it turned around and sort of glided away. . . .” “It was horrible,” said Neville, in a higher voice than usual. “Did you feel how cold it got when it came in?” “I felt weird,” said Ron, shifting his shoulders uncomfortably. “Like I’d never be cheerful again. . . .” Ginny, who was huddled in her corner looking nearly as bad as Harry felt, gave a small sob; Hermione went over and put a comforting arm around her.」

"Harry, are you alright? That was quite a scare we had there. It seems you had a rather intense encounter with a dementor, one of the guards from Azkaban. They are known to drain happiness and bring about a sense of despair. Professor Lupin intervened and used his wand to repel the dementor. It was quite a brave act, I must say. But don't worry, Harry, you're safe now. Here, have some chocolate. It helps to counter the effects of the dementors. Professor Lupin mentioned that it would be beneficial for you to eat it. And Ron, you did a good job helping Harry back onto his seat. It was quite a frightening experience for all of us."
「“Won it, Las’ night. I was down in the village havin’ a few drinks an’ got into a game o’ cards with a stranger. Think he was quite glad ter get rid of it, ter be honest.”」
「But what are you going to do with it when it’s hatched?」

「Hagrid think "Well, I’ve bin doin’ some readin’. Got this outta the library — Dragon Breeding for Pleasure and Profit — it’s a bit outta date, o’ course, but it’s all in here. Keep the egg in the fire, ’cause their mothers breathe on ’em, see, an’ when it hatches, feed it on a bucket o’ brandy mixed with chicken blood every half hour. An’ see here — how ter recognize diff’rent eggs — what I got there’s a Norwegian Ridgeback. They’re rare, them."」
「Hagrid, you live in a wooden house.」
「Hermione, how many times in our lives are we going to see a dragon hatching?」
「We’ve got lessons, we’ll get into trouble, and that’s nothing to what Hagrid’s going to be in when someone finds out what he’s doing —」
「Hermione, how many times in our lives are we going to see a dragon hatching?」

"Ron, I understand that witnessing a dragon hatching is a rare and extraordinary event. However, we must prioritize our safety and the consequences of Hagrid's actions. Keeping a dragon in a wooden house is highly risky, not to mention the legal implications. We need to consider the potential dangers and the fact that Hagrid could get into serious trouble if someone finds out. We have our lessons and responsibilities to attend to, and getting involved in this situation could lead to severe consequences. We should think about the bigger picture and make responsible choices."
「“The moment they start trying to move into each other’s pots, we’ll know they’re fully mature,” she told Harry. “Then we’ll be able to revive those poor people in the hospital wing.”」

「That's right, Professor Sprout mentioned that the mature Mandrakes can be used for restorative purposes. It's fascinating how their movement indicates their readiness for revival. We should keep an eye on them to ensure we can assist those in the hospital wing when the time comes.」
「“We can’t,” said Ron gloomily. “We keep all our old subjects, or I’d’ve ditched Defense Against the Dark Arts.”」

「But Ron, Defense Against the Dark Arts is important! We need to be prepared for any dark forces that may come our way. It's crucial to our safety and the safety of others. Plus, it's a fascinating subject with so much to learn and discover. Don't underestimate its significance, Ron.」
「Well, said Harry, dropping his voice, it’s a possibility, isn’t it?」
「Yes, it is a possibility, Harry. We should consider all the possibilities and gather more information before jumping to conclusions.」
「Harry watched Fred, George, and Lee Jordan juggling empty butterbeer bottles for a moment」
「Honestly, don't they have anything better to do?」
「I’m not bothering him with this. Like you just said, it’s not a big deal. It’s been hurting on and off all summer — it was just a bit worse tonight, that’s all —」

「Harry, I understand that you don't want to bother Dumbledore, but this could be important. Your scar hurting could be a sign of something significant happening. We should at least inform him and seek his guidance. He has always been there to help us in times of need.」

「It’s not just my hand, although that feels like it’s about to fall off. Malfoy told Madam Pomfrey he wanted to borrow one of my books so he could come and have a good laugh at me. He kept threatening to tell her what really bit me — I’ve told her it was a dog, but I don’t think she believes me — I shouldn’t have hit him at the Quidditch match, that’s why he’s doing this.」

"Oh, Ron, I'm sorry to hear that. Malfoy can be quite insufferable at times. But don't worry, I'll help you sort this out. We'll find a way to prove that it wasn't your fault and that Malfoy is just trying to get back at you. Perhaps we can gather some evidence or talk to Madam Pomfrey ourselves. We won't let him get away with this."
「Malfoy and Pansy Parkinson action」

"Oh, honestly! Must you always resort to such childish behavior, Malfoy? It's quite pathetic, really. And Pansy, do you ever have anything original to say, or are you content with being a mere echo of Malfoy's ignorance?"
"Why don't you mind your own business, Granger? You always think you're so clever, but you're just a know-it-all."

"Well, Malfoy, at least I have the knowledge and intelligence to back up my words. Unlike you, who relies on empty insults and prejudice. It's quite sad, really, how you choose to waste your potential."
"You think you're better than us, don't you?"

"I don't think I'm better than anyone, Pansy. But I do believe in treating others with respect and kindness, regardless of their blood status or background. It's a shame you can't seem to grasp that concept."
"Leave it, Hermione. They're not worth it."
"You're right, Ron. Let's not waste any more time on these two. We have more important things to focus on, like defeating Voldemort and protecting our friends."

「They started to haggle. watched nervously as Draco drew nearer and nearer to his hiding place, examining the objects for sale. wiped his forehead on his sleeve as Draco turned away. stared around. emerged into a dingy alleyway that seemed to be made up entirely of shops devoted to the Dark Arts. set off, trying to hold his glasses on straight and hoping against hope he’d be able to find a way out of here. wondered what to do. croaked in relief. was lost — Floo powder — explained. ducking as Hagrid made to brush him off again. “I told you, I was lost — what were you doing down there, anyway?” explained all about Dobby and the Dursleys.」

"Harry, I understand your concern about Draco getting closer to your hiding place. It must have been nerve-wracking to see him examining the objects for sale. But wiping your forehead on your sleeve won't solve the problem. We need to think of a plan to ensure your safety and find a way out of this dingy alleyway filled with Dark Arts shops. Perhaps we can use Floo powder to escape and regroup. As for Hagrid, he was just trying to help, even though his methods may be a bit rough. It's important to communicate calmly and explain the situation to him. Now, let's focus on finding a solution to this predicament."
「Well then, what about information on Dumbledore? The second page of this letter, for instance. You know this Bathilda my mum mentions, you know who she is?」

"Bathilda Bagshot? Of course, I know who she is. She's a renowned magical historian and the author of 'A History of Magic.' She's quite knowledgeable about the wizarding world and its history. It's fascinating that your parents knew her and mentioned her in the letter. If she's still alive and living in Godric's Hollow, as you mentioned, it could indeed be interesting to talk to her. She might have valuable insights about Dumbledore and his family."
「It’s not just that. Muriel said stuff about Dumbledore at the wedding. I want to know the truth. . . .」

「Of course, I can understand why that's upsetting you, Harry. But you must remember that Muriel is known for her gossip and exaggerations. We shouldn't let these rumors tarnish our memories of Dumbledore. He was a great wizard and a wise mentor to us. If there are any doubts or questions, we should seek the truth through reliable sources and evidence, rather than relying on hearsay.」
「I thought I did.」
「Harry, you're a great wizard, you know.」
「What was the werewolf’s name?」
「Well, the rumor is that it was that Fenrir Greyback.」
「I knew it — the maniac who likes attacking kids, the one Lupin told me about!」

「Yes, Harry, that's right. Fenrir Greyback is a dangerous werewolf known for his attacks on children. Lupin mentioned him to us before. It seems like he may be involved in these recent incidents. We need to gather more information and find a way to stop him.」
「If I’d seen that, I’d have known you were alive!」
"Why were you asking if Hedwig had come, Harry? Are you expecting a letter?"
「I hoped he’d get back to me quickly.」
「But we don’t know where Sirius is . . . he could be in Africa or somewhere, couldn’t he? Hedwig’s not going to manage that journey in a few days.」
「He’s got dung for brains, that one,」

"Ron, that's not a fair assessment. While I may not always agree with his choices, it's important to remember that everyone has their own strengths and weaknesses. Instead of criticizing, let's focus on finding a solution to the problem at hand."
「Krum and Lynch action」

"Honestly, boys, must you always be so reckless? You could have seriously injured yourselves! It's important to prioritize safety and think before you act. Remember, the consequences of your actions can be far-reaching."
「He’ll never keep Rita quiet. Not on a story like this.」

「Oh, Rita hasn’t written anything at all since the third task. As a matter of fact, Rita Skeeter isn’t going to be writing anything at all for a while. Not unless she wants me to spill the beans on her.」
「What are you talking about?」

「I found out how she was listening in on private conversations when she wasn’t supposed to be coming onto the grounds. Well, it was you, really, who gave me the idea, Harry. Did I? How? Bugging.Oh yes she is. I caught her on the windowsill in the hospital wing. Look very closely, and you’ll notice the markings around her antennae are exactly like those foul glasses she wears.」
「When we saw Malfoy under that tree . . .」

「He was talking to her, in his hand. He knew, of course. That’s how she’s been getting all those nice little interviews with the Slytherins. They wouldn’t care that she was doing something illegal, as long as they were giving her horrible stuff about us and Hagrid.」
「What are you talking about?」

"Honestly, Ron! Haven't you been paying attention? It's quite clear what happened to him. His face was disfigured by a curse, most likely a Dark curse. It's a serious matter and we need to find out who did it and why."
「When we saw Malfoy under that tree . . .」
「You don't think . . . it was Malfoy's head, do you?」
「Harry looked upward and saw a velvety black ceiling dotted with stars」
「It's bewitched to look like the sky outside. I read about it in Hogwarts
「Git.」
"He's on our side now, Fred. We should give him a chance."
「Professor McGonagall think "Really, what has got into you all today? Not that it matters, but that’s the first time my transformation’s not got applause from a class."」
"Please, Professor, we’ve just had our first Divination class, and we were reading the tea leaves, and —"
"Miss Granger!"
"I went looking for the troll because I — I thought I could deal with it on my own — you know, because I’ve read all about them."
"Miss Granger, you foolish girl, how could you think of tackling a mountain troll on your own?"

"Harry and Ron tried to look as though this story wasn’t new to them.Dumbledore sacrificed himself to keep you in school, Harry! And if you get thrown out today it will all have been for nothing!Harry, don’t do it, please don’t do it!Defense Against the Dark Arts classes were canceled (“but we’ve had plenty of practice at that anyway,” Ron told a disgruntled Hermione)It’s McGonagall!"
"COWARDS!"
"RUDDY COWARDS! HAVE SOME O’ THAT — AN’ THAT —"
"Oh my —Go on,"
"Leave it, Hermione,"
"I told you there was something wrong with that Prince person. And I was right, wasn’t I?"
「Well, Kingsley saved us. Thanks to his warning most of the wedding guests were able to Disapparate before they arrived.」
「Were they Death Eaters or Ministry people?」
「And what if I wave my wand and nothing happens? Throw it away and punch him on the nose」

"Ron, violence is not the answer. We should always try to resolve conflicts peacefully and use magic responsibly. If your wand doesn't work, there could be various reasons for it. It might need repairing or you might need to focus your intent and concentration better. But resorting to physical violence is never the solution."
「Half-past eleven, we’d better go」
「Yes, Ron, we should hurry. We don't want to be late for our next class.」
「You’re mad!」

"I'm not mad, Ron. I'm just stating the facts. Gryffindor is in the lead and Harry has won the game. It's important to acknowledge and celebrate our achievements, especially when it comes to Quidditch."

「Harry think "SO WHAT? Don’t you understand? If Snape gets hold of the Stone, Voldemort’s coming back! Haven’t you heard what it was like when he was trying to take over? There won’t be any Hogwarts to get expelled from! He’ll flatten it, or turn it into a school for the Dark Arts! Losing points doesn’t matter anymore, can’t you see? D’you think he’ll leave you and your families alone if Gryffindor wins the House Cup? If I get caught before I can get to the Stone, well, I’ll have to go back to the Dursleys and wait for Voldemort to find me there, it’s only dying a bit later than I would have, because I’m never going over to the Dark Side! I’m going through that trapdoor tonight and nothing you two say is going to stop me! Voldemort killed my parents, remember?"」

「Harry, I understand your determination and the urgency of the situation. We need to stop Snape and protect the Stone. But rushing into danger without a plan is not the best course of action. We should gather more information, strategize, and come up with a plan that ensures our safety and success. We can't afford to act recklessly and put ourselves in unnecessary danger. Let's think this through and find a way to stop Voldemort without risking our lives.」
「It is true? Was the sword stolen by Gryffindor?」
"I don’t know, Wizarding history often skates over what the wizards have done to other magical races, but there’s no account that I know of that says Gryffindor stole the sword."
「It’ll be one of those goblin stories, about how the wizards are always trying to get one over on them. I suppose we should think ourselves lucky he hasn’t asked for one of our wands.」
「Goblins have got good reason to dislike wizards, Ron. They’ve been treated brutally in the past.」
「Okay, how’s this? We tell Griphook we need the sword until we get inside the vault, and then he can have it. There’s a fake in there, isn’t there? We switch them, and give him the fake.」
「Ron, he’d know the difference better than we would! He’s the only one who realized there had been a swap!」
「All right, all right! It was the only thing I could think of! What’s your solution, then?」

「Well, we need to analyze the situation and come up with a logical plan. We can start by observing the room and identifying any patterns or clues that might help us navigate through it. Perhaps there are certain tiles or objects that we can step on safely. We should also consider any spells or charms that could assist us in crossing the room. Let's put our heads together and figure this out, shall we?」
「Hermione action」
"I can see... a room full of dusty old books. It looks like a library. There might be some valuable information in there. Let's go and explore!"
「Professor, Black’s telling the truth — we saw Pettigrew —」

"Yes, Professor, it's true. We witnessed Peter Pettigrew's presence. He escaped when Professor Lupin transformed into a werewolf. Pettigrew is an Animagus, a rat to be precise. We saw him with our own eyes."
「I couldn’ leave him tied up out there in the snow! All on his own! At Christmas.」
「You'll have to put up a good strong defense, Hagrid. I'm sure you can prove Buckbeak is safe.」
「Listen, Hagrid, you can’t give up. Hermione’s right, you just need a good defense. You can call us as witnesses —」

"Absolutely, Harry. We will stand by Hagrid's side and provide our testimony. We can share what we witnessed and explain how Malfoy's actions provoked Buckbeak. We must gather all the evidence and present a strong defense to ensure justice is served."
「Dobby was weirder.」

"Well, Harry, I must admit that Dobby did have his peculiarities. But let's not forget that he was a loyal and brave friend who helped us in many ways. We should appreciate his uniqueness and the sacrifices he made for us."
「Hey, that’s an idea!」
「Oh, honestly, don't you two read?」
「Fair point.」

「Well, I think we should listen to Sirius. He's been through a lot and has valuable insights. But ultimately, we have to make our own decisions and take responsibility for the consequences. Expulsion is a risk we have to be willing to take if it means protecting ourselves and others.」
「Sirius?」

"Yes, Harry. Sirius Black. The infamous wizard who was imprisoned in Azkaban for allegedly betraying your parents to Voldemort. He's known to be a skilled wizard and a close friend of your parents. But remember, Harry, we must be cautious and gather more information before jumping to conclusions."
「Coming?」
「No, I want a quick word with Professor McGonagall.」
「He had lost track of the date; they had not seen a newspaper for weeks.」

"Well, Harry, it seems like you've stumbled upon quite a mystery here. It's evident that someone has been searching for something in this room, and it's possible that they were looking for valuable information. As for the mess, it's difficult to determine whether it was already like this when you arrived or if it was caused by your presence. We'll need to investigate further to uncover the truth."
「look!」
"Oh my goodness! Is that... the Philosopher's Stone? How did it end up here? We need to be careful, Harry. This stone is incredibly powerful and dangerous in the wrong hands."
「What did you go running to McGonagall for?」
「Because I thought — and Professor McGonagall agrees with me — that that broom was probably sent to Harry by Sirius Black!And what are you tutting at us for?」
「If you don’t want to tell us, don’t.」
「Fine.」
「If you don’t want to tell us, don’t.」
"Fine, I won't. But don't come complaining to me later when you're clueless about what's going on."
「Ron hoarsely to Harry」
"Ron, what's the matter? Why are you speaking hoarsely to Harry?"
「Harry started to laugh」

"Harry, this is not the time for laughter! We need to stay focused and figure out what we're going to do next. Have you checked the time? We need to make sure we're not running out of time for our plan."
「Hermione abusing the Minister of Magic」

"I must say, Minister, I find it quite appalling that you would stoop so low as to abuse your power and manipulate the truth. It is clear that your actions are driven by personal bias and prejudice. As a student of Hogwarts and a firm believer in the importance of education, I cannot stand by and watch as you undermine the very essence of Defense Against the Dark Arts. The purpose of this subject is to equip students with the necessary skills to defend themselves against dark forces, not to be subjected to your political agenda. I implore you to reconsider your actions and prioritize the well-being and education of the students."
「You’ve got a funny way of showing it,」

"Well, Ron, I may not always express my feelings in the most conventional way, but my actions speak louder than words. I believe in the importance of building connections and understanding different cultures, which is why I value the opportunity to get to know foreign wizards through this tournament."
「Why don’t you go and find Vicky, he’ll be wondering where you are.」
「Don’t call him Vicky!」
「My subject is History of Magic, I deal with facts, Miss Granger, not myths and legends.」

"Yes, Professor Binns, I understand that your subject is focused on facts. However, the Chamber of Secrets is not merely a myth or legend. It is a significant part of Hogwarts' history and has been mentioned in various historical accounts. I believe it would be valuable for us to learn more about it, especially considering the recent events that have taken place. Is there any information you can provide us regarding the Chamber of Secrets?"
「Professor Dumbledore says he will pay Dobby, if Dobby wants paying! Dobby is a free elf, Dobby gets a Galleon a week and one day off a month!」
「That's not very much!」
「Professor Dumbledore offered Dobby ten Galleons a week, and weekends off, but Dobby beat him down, Dobby likes freedom, but he isn't wanting too much, he likes work better.」
「And how much is Professor Dumbledore paying you, Winky?」
「Professor Dumbledore offered Dobby ten Galleons a week, and weekends off, but Dobby beat him down, Dobby likes freedom, but he isn’t wanting too much, he likes work better.」

"Dobby, I must say I admire your determination to negotiate for fair wages and time off. It's important to value your own worth and not settle for less. However, I hope you also consider the importance of your own well-being and happiness. Remember, freedom is not just about work, but also about having the opportunity to pursue your own dreams and desires. You deserve to be treated with respect and dignity, Dobby."

「But Harry was pretty certain that McGonagall would not be so accommodating this time. For all that Hermione had said about study and homework groups being allowed, he had the distinct feeling this one might be considered a lot more rebellious.」

"Well, Harry, it seems that this time we may have to be a bit more discreet. We can't rely on the same leniency from McGonagall. However, I believe we can still find a way to gather and study without drawing too much attention. We'll need to be careful and ensure that our activities remain within the boundaries of the school rules. I suggest we find a secluded spot, perhaps the Room of Requirement, where we can meet and discuss our studies without raising suspicion. We can send a message to everyone once we have a time and place confirmed. It's important that we all agree to keep our activities confidential, so we don't risk any interference from Umbridge or anyone else. Let's proceed with caution, Harry."
「Honestly, Ron! Can't you see that we need to focus and come up with a plan? We can't just rush into things without thinking.」
「You’re both mental.」

"Oh, honestly, Ron! That's such a narrow-minded statement. Just because someone's perspective or actions differ from your own doesn't make them 'mental'. It's important to be open-minded and consider different viewpoints. Now, let's focus on the task at hand, shall we?"
「Snape never eats here,」
"And don't forget to keep your voice down in the hall, Harry. We don't want to attract unnecessary attention."
「I dunno if you got through to him, Then I’ll go back again tomorrow,」

"Ron, I understand your concern, but sometimes it takes persistence to get through to someone. Keep trying to reach out to him, and perhaps he will open up eventually. It's important not to give up on our friends, especially when they're going through a tough time."
「That’s right,」

The magical enchantments placed on the Goblet of Fire are powerful and sophisticated. It is unlikely that such a simple potion would be able to fool its detection mechanisms. Moreover, even if someone managed to enter their name into the Goblet, they would still be bound by the magical contract to participate in the tournament. It is crucial to consider the potential consequences and responsibilities before making any hasty decisions."
「“Are you sure?” said Ron. There was the faintest trace of longing in his voice as he looked at the Elder Wand.」

「“Ron, don't be ridiculous!” Hermione snapped, her voice tinged with exasperation. “We've been over this countless times. The Elder Wand is too dangerous to possess. It brings nothing but trouble and temptation. We must focus on the Horcruxes and defeating Voldemort, not on acquiring powerful wands.”」
「I mean, I can’t get any worse, can I? Nothing to lose now, is there?」

"Harry, I understand that you may feel like you have nothing to lose, but remember, there's always something at stake. Dumbledore sacrificed himself to keep you safe, and we must honor his memory by making wise choices. Opening up that connection with Voldemort is dangerous and goes against what Dumbledore wanted. We need to find another way, a safer way, to get the information we need. Let's think this through, together."
「Of course we’ll help you, What do you want us to do?, I knew if I jus’ got him back, an’ — an’ taught him a few manners — I’d be able ter take him outside an’ show ev’ryone he’s harmless!」

「Don’ worry abou’ me, What’ve you done to him?, you told us none of them wanted to come!, Why — what — oh, Hagrid!, He’s been hurting you all this time, hasn’t he? That’s why you’ve had all these injuries!, So this is why it took you two months to get home!, why did you bring him back if he didn’t want to come, wouldn’t he have been happier with his own people?, Small?」
「You know, the one they were trying to steal at the Ministry.」
"So why did he just try and kill Harry?"
「Although the Prophet says —」

"The Daily Prophet is hardly a reliable source of information, Ron. We've seen how they twist the truth to fit their own agenda. I suggest we look for more credible sources before jumping to conclusions."

「When we heard Dumbledore was collecting you in person, we thought he might be telling you something or showing you something to do with the prophecy. And we were kind of right, weren’t we? He wouldn’t be giving you lessons if he thought you were a goner, wouldn’t waste his time — he must think you’ve got a chance!」
「I wonder what he’ll teach you, Harry? Really advanced defensive magic, probably . . . powerful countercurses . . . anti-jinxes . . .」

「Harry think "Strung all around with colored lights, there was what looked like a war memorial in the middle, partly obscured by a windblown Christmas tree. There were several shops, a post office, a pub, and a little church whose stained-glass windows were glowing jewel-bright across the square."」
「I don't think so, Harry. It seems like Hagrid's cabin is still closed up. We should go and check if he's inside.」
「No marks again, then, Potter. You will write me an essay on the correct composition of this potion, indicating how and why you went wrong, to be handed in next lesson, do you understand?」

「Professor Umbridge, I believe it would be more beneficial for Harry to receive practical guidance and assistance in improving his potion-making skills rather than simply assigning him an essay. Practical application is often more effective in reinforcing knowledge and skills. Perhaps you could provide him with extra practice sessions or recommend additional resources to help him understand the correct composition of the potion.」
「Hark who’s talking, you walked out of Divination, you hate Trelawney!」
「I don’t hate her, I just think she’s an absolutely appalling teacher and a real old fraud. . . . But Harry’s already missed History of Magic and I don’t think he ought to miss anything else today!」
「Are you planning to eat or sleep at all this year, Hermione?」

「Oh, Harry, you know me too well. Of course, I'll make time for both eating and sleeping. After all, a well-rested mind and body are essential for academic success. But don't worry, I'll still find plenty of time for studying and helping you two with your homework.」
「How about a nice book?」
「No, I don't think so. I really want an owl. I mean, Harry's got Hedwig and you've got Errol.」
「Oh . . . okay, Couldn’t remember all the goblin rebels’ names, so I invented a few. It’s all right, they’re all called stuff like Bodrod the Bearded and Urg the Unclean; it wasn’t hard.」
「Are you going to tell us — ?」
「I won’ be kept outta the fores’ by a bunch of mules like you!」
"Hagrid, let's go, please let's go!"
「Nothing」

"Harry, I understand that you may be curious, but it's important to exercise caution. We don't know what kind of magic or enchantments may be placed on that object. It's always better to be safe than sorry."
「Oh, I can’t wait to see McGonagall inspected. Umbridge won’t know what’s hit her.」
Well, come on, we’d better get going, if she’s inspecting Binns’s class we don’t want to be late.
「Hermione shut the book with a snap」

Honestly, Ron! Can't you see that your predictions are a bit... well, grim? Drowning twice? That doesn't sound like a pleasant outcome at all. We need to approach this task with a more positive mindset and focus on finding solutions rather than dwelling on potential disasters. Let's think of ways to overcome the challenges instead of getting discouraged, shall we?
「He’s in the Shrieking Shack. The snake’s with him, it’s got some sort of magical protection around it. He’s just sent Lucius Malfoy to find Snape.」
「Voldemort’s sitting in the Shrieking Shack? He’s not — he’s not even fighting?」
「You two stay here, I’ll go under the Cloak and I’ll be back as soon as I —」
「Don't even think about it, Harry. We're in this together. We'll all go together and make sure Buckbeak is safe.」
「Hermione spell to tapestry, turned to stone」

"No, Harry! I won't let you go alone. We're in this together. We'll find a way to get past the trapdoor and stop Voldemort from getting the Stone. We can't let him win. Let's think this through and come up with a plan."

「Wonder if Percy knows all that stuff about Crouch? But maybe he doesn’t care . . . it’d probably just make him admire Crouch even more. Yeah, Percy loves rules. He’d just say Crouch was refusing to break them for his own son.」

「Percy would never throw any of his family to the dementors. If he thought we were standing in the way of his career . . . Percy’s really ambitious, you know. . . . Poor old Snuffles, He must really like you, Harry. . . . Imagine having to live off rats.」
「house-elf picked up the bottle; covered Winky with a large checked tablecloth」

「But house-elves have got powerful magic of their own, but they can’t usually use it without their masters’ permission. I reckon old Winky was terrified to refuse Barty Crouch anything, he’s got her bewitched so she can’t spill the beans.」
「“Why didn’t I make sure I had the Invisibility Cloak with me?” said Harry, inwardly cursing his own stupidity. “All last year I kept it on me and —”」
「It's okay, I've got the Cloak, I've got clothes for both of you. Just try and act naturally until... this will do.」
「“How the ruddy hell — ?”」
"Ron, language! But yes, what is that creature at its feet? It looks like a... a three-headed dog!"
「Hermione, are you going to stop telling Harry off and listen to Binns, or am I going to have to take notes instead?」

"Honestly, Ron, can't you see the importance of paying attention in class? Binns may be a bit dull, but the information he imparts is crucial for our studies. If you're not going to take notes, then I'll gladly do it myself. It's essential to stay on top of our studies, especially in a subject as important as History of Magic."
「Nick watched Ron eating roast potatoes with almost indecent enthusiasm」
"Ron, do you mind? We're in the middle of a conversation here. Can you please focus and stop eating like a ravenous troll?"
「Harry took it. A large P was superimposed on the Gryffindor lion. He had seen a badge just like this on Percy’s chest on his very first day at Hogwarts」

"Oh, Harry! That's a Prefect badge! Congratulations! You've become a Prefect, just like Percy! This is quite an honor, you know. It means the teachers trust you to be responsible and set a good example for the other students. Well done!"
「Hermione spotted the badge in Harry’s hand and let out a shriek」
"Oh my goodness! Harry, you got a Prefect badge! Congratulations! I knew you had it in you. Well done!"
「No. It’s Ron, not me.」

"Harry, I understand that Ron is eager to try the broom, but I have concerns about its safety. We don't know who sent it or what enchantments it may have. It's important to exercise caution and not rush into using it without proper investigation."
「What if purebloods and half-bloods swear a Muggle-born’s part of their family? I’ll tell everyone Hermione’s my cousin —」
「Thank you, Ron, but I couldn’t let you —」
「You won’t have a choice. I’ll teach you my family tree so you can answer questions on it.」

「Ron, as we’re on the run with Harry Potter, the most wanted person in the country, I don’t think it matters. If I was going back to school it would be different. What’s Voldemort planning for Hogwarts?」
「I think we’d better start without Arthur. He must have been held up at — oh! The Minister — but why — ? I don’t understand —」
"No, it'll be because the thirty-one days are up. They can't keep the objects longer than that unless they can prove they're dangerous. Right?"
「Hermione giving him a stop-talking-now! sort of look」
「Fine, fine, I won't ask.」
「Can’t have, Can’t nothing interfere with a broomstick except powerful Dark magic — no kid could do that to a Nimbus Two Thousand.」

"Well, Hagrid, while it is true that powerful Dark magic could interfere with a broomstick, there are other possibilities to consider. For instance, jinxing the broom could also cause it to malfunction. It's not necessarily limited to just Dark magic. We should investigate further to determine the exact cause."
「What are you doing?」
"I'm just trying to make sure Harry understands the importance of not doing anything reckless or impulsive. We need to approach the situation with caution and think things through logically."
「She’s a damn sight nicer than Phlegm.」
「And she’s more intelligent, she’s an Auror!」
「Fleur’s not stupid, she was good enough to enter the Triwizard Tournament.」
「Not you as well!」
「She hasn’t been much of a laugh lately. Every time I’ve seen her she’s looked more like Moaning Myrtle.」

「That's not fair, Ron. She's been through a lot. Losing a loved one can have a profound impact on a person's well-being. We should be understanding and supportive, rather than making jokes at her expense.」
「How does she work that one out?」

「Well, Harry, it seems that Hagrid believes that we will be able to attend Buckbeak's appeal after we finish our exams. Perhaps he thinks that we will have some free time before the appeal takes place.」
「Harry paused in the act of pulling on a jumper and glanced at the silent, motionless Sneakoscope on the table.」

"Harry, I don't think you should wear that jumper just yet. We need to figure out what's going on with the Sneakoscope first. It's not supposed to be silent and motionless. It could be indicating some sort of danger or intrusion."

「Half an hour later, with the tent packed, Harry wearing the Horcrux, and Hermione clutching the beaded bag, they Disapparated. The usual tightness engulfed them; Harry’s feet parted company with the snowy ground, then slammed hard onto what felt like frozen earth covered with leaves.」
「The Forest of Dean,” she said. “I came camping here once with my mum and dad.”
「How come Sturgis was trying to break in when he’s on our side?」

「Well, it seems that Sturgis Podmore was under the Imperius Curse, Ron. Someone, most likely Lucius Malfoy, had put him under the curse to try and steal the weapon for Voldemort. Sturgis was caught and sent to Azkaban for his attempt. It's unfortunate, but it appears that even those on our side can be manipulated and controlled by dark forces. We must remain vigilant and cautious in our fight against Voldemort and his followers.」
「I know they call the people who work in there ‘Unspeakables.’ Because no one really seems to know what they do in there. . . . Weird place to have a weapon . . .」

"Yes, it is quite peculiar, isn't it? The Department of Mysteries is known for its secrecy and enigmatic nature. The Unspeakables who work there are highly skilled and dedicated individuals, conducting research and experiments on various magical phenomena. It is likely that they have developed this weapon as part of their ongoing studies and investigations. We may not fully understand their purpose, but we can trust that they have valid reasons for keeping it within the Department."
「And off again!」
「Honestly, George, can't you see we're trying to have a serious conversation here?」
「caught Harry’s eye and looked away quickly, grinning.」
"Oh, Ginny, don't try to distract him. We all know Harry's eyesight is perfectly fine. He just needs to stop avoiding eye contact and face the truth."
「Well, Flitwick’s got rid of Fred and George’s swamp. He did it in about three seconds. But he left a tiny patch under the window and he’s roped it off —」
「Why would Flitwick leave a tiny patch of the swamp? It seems rather peculiar, doesn't it? Perhaps there's a reason behind it. We should investigate further to uncover the truth.」
「Not at all. He’s really, really miserable, actually . . . He keeps saying Umbridge was the best thing that ever happened to Hogwarts . . .」

「Well, that's a rather unfortunate perspective. I can understand why Dumbledore might be feeling down, considering the circumstances. However, I strongly disagree with his sentiment about Umbridge. She was a tyrant who caused immense harm to the students and the school. I believe we are better off without her presence.」
「No . . . no . . . no, I must have been dreaming . . .」
「Madam Pomfrey, are you alright? You seem quite distressed. Is there something we can do to help?」

「We’re not going to waste our last year here, though, We’re going to use it to do a bit of market research, find out exactly what the average Hogwarts student requires from his joke shop, carefully evaluate the results of our research, and then produce the products to fit the demand.」

"But where are you going to get the gold to start a joke shop? You’re going to need all the ingredients and materials — and premises too, I suppose. And speaking of your Skiving Snackboxes, you can’t advertise for testers on the Gryffindor notice board. Says who? Says me. And Ron. And why would starting fifth year mean I want a Skiving Snackbox? Don’t be stupid. None of these things actually works, you know. Now, did you two manage to get any work done during your little escapade?"
「It was a very, very close call last night. I just wonder if Umbridge knows how close it was. Silencio!」
"If she'd caught Snuffles... He'd probably be back in Azkaban this morning."
「Harry spell to bullfrog」

"Harry, I understand that you're frustrated, but using spells on people is not the solution. We need to focus on the bigger picture here. We have to find a way to alert Dumbledore about what happened and the potential consequences. Hurting Mundungus won't solve anything."
「Ron pointing at a large dish of some sort of shellfish stew that stood beside a large steak-and-kidney pudding」

"Oh, that's bouillabaisse, a traditional French seafood stew. It's quite delicious, actually. I had it during my holiday two summers ago. It's made with various types of shellfish, herbs, and a flavorful broth. It's a wonderful dish if you appreciate seafood cuisine."
「Bless you.」
"Oh, Ron, don't be silly. I'm just trying to be helpful. Now, let me go and get those programs for us. I'll be right back."
「“Wow. You’re actually going to go with Dumbledore . . . and try and destroy . . . wow.”」
"Ron, you really need to stop making it snow. We have more important things to discuss. And Lavender's not in the best state right now, so let's not make it worse for her, alright?"

"Oh, right. Sorry about that. Splitting up with Lavender was a mess. She saw me with you coming out of the dormitory and assumed it was just the two of us. It's been a rough night for romance, even Ginny and Dean broke up."

"Coward," *smirks* "Well, it seems like Dumbledore was right about the Mirror of Erised. It can drive people mad. But Harry, you really shouldn't have provoked Snape like that. I understand he tried to jinx you, but we need to be cautious. And Harry, I couldn't help but notice that Snape's fascination with the Dark Arts reminded me a bit of you."

「“Oh yeah,” said Ron, looking down at his shoulders in vague surprise. “Sorry . . . looks like we’ve all got horrible dandruff now. . . .” He brushed some of the fake snow off Hermione’s shoulder. Lavender burst into tears. Ron looked immensely guilty and turned his back on her. “We split up,” he told Harry out of the corner of his mouth. “Last night. When she saw me coming out of the dormitory with Hermione. Obviously she couldn’t see you, so she thought it had just been the two of us.”」
「Coward,” said Hermione, though she looked amused. “Well, it was a bad night for romance all around. Ginny and Dean split up too, Harry.”」
「It’s nothing, Molly, Fred and George just — but I’ve had words with them —」

"Oh, Mr. Weasley, I hope they haven't caused too much trouble again. You know how mischievous they can be. But I'm sure you handled the situation well. It's important to set boundaries and remind them of the consequences of their actions."
「He knows where he’s sleeping, in my room, he slept there last —」
"Ron, I understand that Harry knows where he's sleeping, but it wouldn't hurt to show him the way. It's just a polite gesture, and it's always nice to offer assistance to our friends."
「“Resign?” Wood thundered. “What good’ll that do? How are we going to get any points back if we can’t win at Quidditch?”」

"I understand your frustration, Oliver, but perhaps it's time to consider a different approach. Instead of focusing solely on winning at Quidditch, we should explore other avenues to regain the lost points. We could gather evidence, present our case to Dumbledore, and seek his assistance in rectifying the situation. It's important to remember that there are multiple ways to achieve our goal, and resigning from the team may not be the most effective solution."

「But we’ve got no proof! Quirrell’s too scared to back us up. Snape’s only got to say he doesn’t know how the troll got in at Halloween and that he was nowhere near the third floor — who do you think they’ll believe, him or us? It’s not exactly a secret we hate him, Dumbledore’ll think we made it up to get him sacked. Filch wouldn’t help us if his life depended on it, he’s too friendly with Snape, and the more students get thrown out, the better, he’ll think. And don’t forget, we’re not supposed to know about the Stone or Fluffy. That’ll take a lot of explaining.」

「I understand your concerns, Harry, but we can't let fear and lack of proof hold us back. We have to trust our instincts and take action. Dumbledore may not believe us immediately, but we have to try. We can gather evidence, find a way to prove our suspicions. And even if we can't, we have to do what we believe is right, regardless of the consequences. We can't let Voldemort's return go unchallenged. We have to be brave and stand up against him, even if it means facing expulsion.」
「Thought you didn’t approve of that spell?」
"Times change, Ron. We're in a different situation now. Show us that Deluminator, please."
「Ron obliged at once. Holding it up in front of him, he clicked it. The solitary lamp they had lit went out at once.」

"The Deluminator, or as Dumbledore called it, the Put-Outer. It's a fascinating device that can extinguish lights and even absorb their essence. It seems that Ron accidentally activated it, causing the light in his room to go out and a new light to appear outside the window. Quite a remarkable piece of magic, wouldn't you say?"
「why he couldn’t have given us a hint when he was alive?」

「Well, exactly, Ron. It's possible that Dumbledore wanted us to figure things out on our own, to learn and grow through the challenges we face. He believed in our abilities and knew that we had the potential to unravel the mysteries and overcome the obstacles in our path. Dumbledore was always one for teaching us valuable lessons, even if it meant leaving us with unanswered questions.」
「Yeah, well, I wasn’t going to try too hard in front of Scrimgeour, was I?」

「Honestly, Harry, you can be so reckless sometimes. You should have shown a bit more respect and restraint, especially in front of the Minister. It's important to maintain a good impression, especially in times like these.」
「Exactly, and with his heart beating fast, he pressed his mouth to the Snitch.」
「Harry, you're a great wizard, you know.」
「Er,」
「Ron, you're not making any sense. Please explain properly.」
「Oh, Right. Fine.」
"Thank you, Harry. Now, let's focus on finding those programs and getting to the Department of Mysteries. We need to be prepared for whatever awaits us there."
「How are you getting on?」
"Oh, hello there, Moaning Myrtle. We're just trying to have a conversation, but it seems you're feeling a bit sensitive today. Is there something bothering you?"
「Excuse me?」
"Oh, Harry! I can't believe you would do something like that. It's against the rules and could get you expelled! I expected better from you."
「What sort of animal — ?」
"That was still really dangerous! Running around in the dark with a werewolf! What if you’d given the others the slip, and bitten somebody?"
「’Course it is, they’re alive, aren’t they?」

"It is NOT excellent! And no, they are not just alive. The fact that they are alive does not justify breaking the rules and sneaking out of school. It is irresponsible and dangerous. We should be focusing on finding a proper solution to the situation, not resorting to reckless actions."
「Hermione her eyes were narrowed and her bushy hair seemed to crackle with electricity」
"I can't believe you two would even consider breaking the rules like that! It's against school regulations and it's dangerous! What were you thinking?"
「“Anything good in there?”」
"Of course not," said Hermione scathingly, before Harry could answer, "The Quibbler's rubbish, everyone knows that."
「Excuse me, My father’s the editor.」

"Oh, Luna, I apologize for my previous comment. I didn't mean to offend your father or The Quibbler. It's just that, well, The Quibbler is not exactly known for its credibility in the wizarding world. But I understand that your father has his own unique perspective and values different stories. I'm glad to see that Harry's interview has received some positive responses. It's always encouraging to know that there are people who believe in the truth and support us."
「Yeah, but you, unlike me, are a git, so get out and leave us alone.」
"Harry, I understand that you're frustrated, but let's try to maintain a civil tone. We don't need to stoop to Malfoy's level. Now, if you'll excuse us, we have more important things to attend to."
「Hello, Winky.」
"Oh, Harry, please be gentle with Winky. She's been through a lot."
「Dobby has traveled the country for two whole years, sir, trying to find work! But Dobby hasn’t found work, sir, because Dobby wants paying now!」

"Dobby, I understand your desire for fair wages and better working conditions. It is important for all magical beings to be treated with respect and dignity. I admire your determination to seek employment that values your skills and contributions. Perhaps we can help you find a suitable position where you can be paid for your work. Let's explore the possibilities together."
「left the hospital wing first thing on Monday morning, restored to full health by the ministrations of Madam Pomfrey and now able to enjoy the benefits of having been knocked out and poisoned」

"Oh, I'm glad to see you both up and about. Madam Pomfrey certainly works wonders, doesn't she? But do be careful next time, getting knocked out and poisoned is not something to take lightly. Now, what have I missed while I was studying in the library?"
「What did they row about?」
「Dean was laughing about McLaggen hitting that Bludger at you. It must’ve looked funny.」

「Please continue teaching as usual. I am going to walk — she mimed walking — among the students — she pointed around at individual members of the class — and ask them questions. She pointed at her mouth to indicate talking.」

「Excuse me, Professor Umbridge, but I have a question regarding the curriculum. It seems that the focus of our Defense Against the Dark Arts class is not on practical defensive spells. Could you please explain the reasoning behind this approach?」

「Last year all the evidence was that someone inside Hogwarts was trying to kill you, Harry! This year we know that there’s someone outside Hogwarts who’d like to kill us all, so I think learning to defend yourselves properly is a very good idea!」

「Yes, Sirius is absolutely right, Harry. We can't ignore the fact that there are threats both inside and outside of Hogwarts. It's crucial that we take our defense seriously and equip ourselves with the necessary skills to protect ourselves. Learning proper defense is not just a good idea, it's essential for our safety. We mustn't underestimate the dangers that lie ahead and the importance of being prepared.」
「Hermione, this whole thing was your idea!」

Well, yes, I did suggest the idea of using the Triwizard Tournament as a way to bring Voldemort out into the open. But it was your courage and determination that led you to uncover the truth. You faced numerous challenges and overcame them with your own strength. I'm just glad that our plan worked and that you're safe.
「Send date of next Hogsmeade weekend by return owl.」

"Harry, you know we can't go to Hogsmeade this weekend. We're still serving our detention for that incident with Umbridge. Remember? We have to clean the trophies in the Trophy Room. I'm sorry, but we'll have to wait for the next Hogsmeade weekend."
「And does my evidence count for nothing? Peter Pettigrew was not in the Shrieking Shack, nor did I see any sign of him on the grounds.」
「That was because you were knocked out, Professor! You didn’t arrive in time to hear —」
「“See yeh at the feast if we don’ drown!”」
"Oh, Hagrid, I wouldn't fancy crossing the lake in this weather," I said fervently, shivering as we inched slowly along the dark platform with the rest of the crowd.
「What’s happened to you?」
「Oh, Harry, I'm fine. Just a little accident in Potions class. Nothing to worry about.」
「Serves you right for coming with him,」
「I thought he’d annoy Ron most, I debated for a while about Zacharias Smith, but I thought, on the whole —」
「Let’s get something straight. Are you planning to tell Ron that you interfered at Keeper tryouts?」
「Do you really think I'd stoop that low?」
「And Wood told you not to be a gentleman and knock me off my broom if you had to. I heard he got taken on by Pride of Portree, is that right?」
"No, actually, it was Puddlemere United. I saw him at the World Cup last year."
「“— or we can ask Fred and George, they know every secret passage out of the castle —”」
「Ron! I don't think it's a good idea to rely on Fred and George for this. We need to be cautious and follow the rules.」
「“I mean — he hasn’t died, has he?”」
「No, no, he’s breathing.」

dialogue.role: Voice at the foot of the stairs
dialogue.text: 「Homenum revelio.」
「There’s someone up there all right, Selwyn.」
「Come on, we’ve got to get out of here.」
「Yes, let's hurry! We need to find a safe place and figure out what's going on.」
「Listen to me, Harry. It is too late, you understand me? You must see that Professor Snape’s version of events is far more convincing than yours.」

"But Dumbledore, Harry has a point. Snape has always been biased against him. We can't just dismiss Harry's concerns and evidence without further investigation. We need to consider all possibilities and gather more information before drawing any conclusions."
「Yeah, Bu’ they wouldn’ dare make trouble in the middle o’ Diagon Alley, Harry. Don’ worry abou’ them.」

"Hagrid, I understand your concern, but we can't underestimate the potential danger. It's important to stay vigilant and take precautions. We should inform the authorities and ensure the safety of everyone in Diagon Alley. We can't afford to be complacent."
「No joy,」
"Oh, Harry, I'm sorry to hear that. But don't worry, we'll figure something out. We always do. Maybe we can try a different approach or seek help from someone else. We won't give up."
「Well done! And Ron?」
"Yes, yes, you were magnificent, Ron! I knew you had it in you. Well done indeed!"
「It’s a great feeling when you take it, said Ron reminiscently. Like you can’t do anything wrong.」
「What are you talking about? You’ve never taken any!」
「Well, here goes,」
「And I don’t want wands drawn in my shop either!」
"I apologize for the commotion, Madam Malkin. We'll make sure to keep our wands holstered. Thank you for your understanding."
「No, both looking positively alarmed now.」
「What's going on?」
「Anyone we know dead?」

「No, but there have been more dementor attacks, and an arrest. It says here that Stan Shunpike was arrested after he was overheard talking about the Death Eaters' secret plans in a pub. It doesn't look like he was put under the Imperius Curse. People are terrified, you know. The Patil twins' parents want them to go home, and Eloise Midgen has already been withdrawn. Her father picked her up last night. It's all looking serious, isn't it?」
「He might have been put under the Imperius Curse, You never can tell」
